programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc: Of trees, pits and stones The famous doctor-explorer Jean-Louis Étienne explains his relationship with trees and his view of climate change. Fruit stones and pits become a raw material in their own right. Exploring the Aldudes Valley in the Basque Country. Stéphane gets to work to transform an old hedge in Anna and Alain's garden. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Girl Power The team takes part in the Swiss ice climbing championship in Saas-Fee. It's decision time for the Exped Team: where will they be going for their expedition? Directed by: Martin Schilt (Switzerland, 2020)

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 2:

Spotlight on bread by the Poilâne family. The swimsuit: a story studded with scandal. In his Parisian workshop at the Viaduc des Arts, Philippe Atienza reveals the craft of the boot-maker to the public gaze. How to wear a long necklace. The portrait of eyewear manufacturer Amaury Cagniard, master craftsman.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Gilles Tournadre
The chef Gilles Tournadre welcomes us to his home city of Rouen, the only French city to have joined the Unesco Creative Cities Network. With a love of Japanese culture and cuisine, the Normandy chef reveals some of the culinary secrets of his region.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life in harmony with nature Carole-Lyne Robin has transformed her life by building an off-grid tiny house. Between working as a volunteer with the reindeer and her job as a wildlife ranger, Carole-Lyne lives in harmony with her environment. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Théâtre du Palais-Royal, for a visit in Italian style. Encounter with the plastic artist Éva Jospin, amidst of her cardboard forests, to discover a world as bucolic as it is timeless. Exploring Paris on a painting theme. Focus on the centuries-old skills of the luthier. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc: Nature at any price Bernard Cwiek has become a past master in the art of creating insect hotels perfectly adapted to garden wildlife. "Biodalism", or using any means necessary to bring more plants into towns and cities. Visiting the gardens of the Château de Kestellic. Don't panic: Valérie and Emwrick. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Kyrgyzstan, here we come From Zurich to Osh, in southern Kyrgyzstan. The team heads off to the foot of the Turkestan Range. A sparsely populated area that gives them a foretaste of the isolation they'll experience in the coming weeks. Directed by: Martin Schilt (Switzerland, 2020)

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 5:

Spotlight on the paper creations by Marianne Guély. All you need to know about red heels. Working with wood, brass, leather, ivory and eggshell: an in-depth look at the craftsmanship of Atelier d'Art Walser. How to wear a Peter Pan collar. Mélissa Serror reinvents vintage jewellery with Sigal Paris.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Éric Pras (1/2)
Land of gastronomy and wine-growing par excellence, Burgundy immerses us in a wealth of taste and flavour, all accompanied by Éric Pras. Veritable ambassador for his region, the three Michelin-starred chef takes us on a voyage from Chagny to Dijon, in the footsteps of talented chefs and passionate producers.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life as a couple aboard a yacht On the Gaspé Peninsula, Julien meets Marie-Pier and Adrien, two thirty-somethings who sold everything to buy a sailing boat and live on it full-time. They also set up a sailing school, La Belle Vie Sailing. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes with the Garde Républicaine. Shells of every description enjoy a new lease of life thanks to the expert fingers of Thomas Boog, interior designer and creator of decorative objects. Three essential addresses for sculpture-lovers. In the Pyrenees, the VillaCampa workshop manufactures exceptional skis made in wood. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc: Nature at any price Bernard Cwiek has become a past master in the art of creating insect hotels perfectly adapted to garden wildlife. "Biodalism", or using any means necessary to bring more plants into towns and cities. Visiting the gardens of the Château de Kestellic. Don't panic: Valérie and Emwrick. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Kyrgyzstan, here we come From Zurich to Osh, in southern Kyrgyzstan. The team heads off to the foot of the Turkestan Range. A sparsely populated area that gives them a foretaste of the isolation they'll experience in the coming weeks. Directed by: Martin Schilt (Switzerland, 2020)

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc:
The legends of Mortain
We head off to explore Mortain and the Sée valley, from waterfalls, to forests, rocks and the famous Mortain mist. An officially listed "Station Verte" known for its mysterious landscapes, it's also a land of legends and folktales, of King Arthur, fairies, goblins and even the devil himself!
Presented by: Vincent Chatelain.

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Pumpkin curry and pesto
To use up the remains of a Halloween pumpkin, Ricardo suggests two recipes to cook both flesh and seeds: a chicken and pumpkin curry and pumpkin seed pesto.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.desc: Marinated chilli peppers and stuffed sweet peppers Mathieu Cloutier marinates biquinho chilli peppers and prepares stuffed and bread-crumbed fried sweet peppers. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Geneviève and Éric, Estrie (Lawrenceville) Determined to leave everything to run a farm, Éric had his work cut out to persuade Geneviève to follow him with their three children. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Vivian, Ontario
Louis helps out a client whose problem takes the form of two orphaned foxes.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Delights from the Middle East We set off on a journey to the Middle East with Manal Drissi, Elkhana Talbi and Les Filles Fattoush, a Syrian food service, and take a detour via Lebanon with the family behind the Trip de Bouffe restaurant. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Les saisons de Pique-assiette
programme.desc:
Seafood tortellini
Annick Jeanmairet welcomes Marilé Micheletti, founder of Pâtes Manie, a small company in Geneva producing fresh filled pasta. On the menu: two-coloured tortellini with seafood filling.
Presented by: Annick Jeanmairet.

programme.title: Chroniques d'en haut
programme.desc:
Champsaur, the two faces of a valley
Home to the sources of the River Drac, in the Hautes-Alpes, the Champsaur Valley perfectly combines tourism and a thriving local community. Winter sports and agriculture help keep the valley in balance, whatever the season.
Presented by: Laurent Guillaume.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the library of the National Institute for Art History. Encounter with the French photographer Carole Bellaïche. Exploring Paris on the trail of a daring scientist: Marie Curie. Focus on Simon, a craftsman armed with patience and passion, who reveals the skills of a rare profession: luthier. Presented by: Katherina Marx.
